title: [K-12] Explicit Science Process Skills Education for Developing Pre-service Science Teachers’ Scientific Reasoning Abilities

context.prior_knowledge: Understanding of secondary science curriculum content and basic science teaching methodologies
context.additional_context: Smartphone-based learning as the primary environment, emphasizing scientific reasoning training using mathematical concepts

learning_goals: Preservice science teachers improve their ability to control variables and engage in hypothetico-deductive reasoning by over 30%.

Using sub-elements of scientific reasoning (variable control, hypothesis-deductive reasoning), learners can write ≥3 math inquiry lesson plans and develop instructional materials meeting ≥4 of 5 evaluation criteria (clarity, creativity, feasibility) in peer reviews and instructor feedback.

Over six months, learners can conduct diagnostic pre/post-assessments in mass conservation, volume measurement, proportionality, and probabilistic reasoning, design/customize learning strategies (≥2 target areas) like visual modeling or real-world applications, and achieve ≥20% score improvement.

constraints.tech_requirements: Limited tech environment (no PC, smartphone only)

difficulty: Hard - Complex requirements with multiple constraints
